Audio Description: A mother and daughter pasting war stamps in a savings booklet is the illustration on this poster with a pale blue background. In the center foreground of the poster is a girl about seven years old, squatting down to place a stamp in a savings book. She is wearing a short-sleeve white blouse with a puffy sleeve trimmed in red. Her short blue skirt has a blue suspender, and the hem of the skirt has a white and blue trim. Her socks are white with a red stripe. In the background to the girl’s left is her watchful mother holding a green war stamp next to a savings booklet. She is wearing the same outfit as her daughter and they both have a red and white candy stripe ribbons in their blonde hair. On the floor next to the young girl is a green military officer’s cap of a deployed husband and father with a brown brim and a gold eagle.  At the top of the poster in black letters are the words: “Even a little can help a lot - NOW.” At the bottom of the poster in black letters are the words: “Buy U.S. War Stamps Bonds.”
Creator: United States. Treasury Department
Description: Poster, 51 x 36 cm, artist: Alfred Parker
